The design, look and feel are all so charming in this game. You can tell the creators wanted to bring back the simple and dynamic gameplay from the iconic game boy advance days. 
The only thing is that I canâ€™t help but compare it with advance wars. So I do miss the stronger character designs along with the co powers to give that individual play style to whomever wishes. 
Still though, this was an excellent purchase. Great game.

Great, although weird game. More complex then you would think. Only negative is the lack of a new campaign. Extensive first first campaign and and add on skirmish like mode.

Itâ€™s an amazing game in the Wars series style, but itâ€™s more than just another clone. Well thought out, tactical and strategic play backed up by beautiful graphics and matchmaking puts it at the top of the genre.
Love the games I think it needs to add more units like a new tank or mortar but besides that I love your game. You should watch include JoJo reference JK

Why would I buy a game that gets boring in a week or so. The developers need to be active and update this game. Two years?! So inactive!
Great game!  I sold my GBA and Advance Wars along with it.  This game is a PERFECT replacement....it is even better in a lot of ways!

If you loved Advance Wars, youâ€™ll love this game, since itâ€™s pretty much a carbon copy. All the gameplay mechanics and units youâ€™re familiar with are here.

I donâ€™t like the new powers system as much, but if you wish Advance Wars had a mobile version, just get this one.
Make the game compatible for iPhone X
If you love Advance Wars, youâ€™ll love this. Great game.

A very fun and beautifully polished rendition of Advance Wars that is great for a long suffering Advance Wars fan like me.

Great: Nice graphics and sound design. Well designed. Actually has sniper units! Straightforward and not free to play crap.

Okay: Music, no battle cut-ins

Meh: Storyline, while it can give you a chuckle or two, it feels like an afterthought and the characters are all generic Schmoes.

For the price, however, it seems like a great value.

This is a really fun version of Advanced Wars.

this is by far the best war simulator, with economic strategies to war plans, its truly a beaut.

Update: they need to really update this game. Maybe add boats? Idk but this gets really boring with the same units over and over again.
I like it.

This is great AW clone. There are few modifications to the base AW game, a unit or two is different and there are different rules on how units carried in a transport behave. The tweaks are good and I miss out on using the Ranger when I go back to AW. All of this makes for great game play!

There is, however, an issue with the game. Multiplayer games suffer from frequent errors "communicating with Game Center". I don't know what this really means, but in practice it means that a player cannot end their turn and must wait 24 hours for their turn to auto-end. I reached out to the developer to report the issue and the response was that I must have a spotty WiFi connection. So...I wasn't very pleased with that response, not sure if they didn't understand the issue or didn't care, but it didn't inspire a lot of faith in the company for me. 

The group I play with have put up with this issue for a couple years but it's gotten old and we're about ready to move on to another game so we don't have wait 2-3 days to lay one round (of a 4 player game). Hopefully the issue will be resolved at some point, other than that, Warbits is fantastic!

title.label: Perfect for those seeking an Advance Wars clone

content.label:
The gameplay in Warbits is great. The developers definitely understand what made Advance Wars so fun and bring that out in this app. My rating of three stars is because half of the game, the multiplayer, is no longer functioning. Since Gamecenter got the boot, all of the multiplayer content is bricked. You arenâ€™t able to do any of it with the exception of local hand-off matches. 
      Great game, guys! Just give it an update to the multiplayer and it will be perfection.
Itâ€™s Advance Wars! Well worth it if you enjoyed those games.

For players of a certain other handheld turn-based strategy game from the GBA years, this is the homage weâ€™ve all been looking for.  This is about as close to perfect as the genre gets.

The matches during the campaign ramp up in difficulty at just the right pace.  The available units fit together in all the right ways to enable boundless options and tactics.  Knowing when and how to use charges tactically is half the battle â€” Guardian is my favorite for holding down routes and enemy unit factories to prevent further enemy action.

The interactions between generals is chuckle-worthy.  The menu and navigation system is downright genius.  You can pick it up in a few minutes, but master it only after several hours.

I love this mobile game in ways man should never love a mobile game.

title.label: Not sure if anyone mentioned this...

content.label: ...but it sure does remind me of Advance Wars.
Itâ€™s like a cutesy version of Military Madness. That is all.

Not woth it for me.  Deleted after 2 games.

Don't recommend

When joining an online two-player game (via message invite) the game will not join if currently in another online match AND after exiting or quitting the app, the invitation does not work...please update!

Had great potential but the developers have abandoned development as of a year ago  

Thereâ€™s no iPhone X support (huge black bars), no new features, no bug fixes

Shame
Challenging and entertaining regardless of the stupid (childish) banter between the aliens.
Fun Game.  Next best thing to Advance Wars going mobil.

This game is an Advance Wars clone. I donâ€™t use the term lightly; itâ€™s not just that the units are almost the same, even the end-of-stage scoring system rates you on Power (% of enemies destroyed), Skill (% of your units that survived), and Speed... even when it doesnâ€™t make sense to do so. On stage 4-4, for instance, you have an ally who helps you against your foe- every unit your ally destroys does not count towards your Power score, making it literally impossible to earn top scores.

Now donâ€™t get me wrong, Warbits is not a bad game. Its core systems, such as its economy, unit balance and variety, mostly copy Advance Wars, which is a really solid system to copy. The reason I give it three stars is because itâ€™s worse in all the areas it cannot directly copy (storyline, aesthetics and visual clarity), and the one area where it tries to innovate and improve upon the old formula with its HQ abilities, it mostly fails. The abilities are poorly balanced, the AI is shamefully poor at using them, and their inclusion harms the gameâ€™s overall unit balance.

As a result of the above, Warbits is a competent game and if you like the genre, you wonâ€™t regret playing it. Itâ€™s also forgettable- it doesnâ€™t advance the genre in any way. When the next game of this type comes out, it will still be compared to Advance Wars, not to Warbits.
Solid advance wars type game. Imagine having a game that fun one your phone

title.label: Miss Advance Wars? This is the game for YOU

content.label: I grew up on gameboy handhelds and to this day the one game I miss is the advance wars series. Warbits has a similar style and feel, but the units are distinct enough that it feels like a new game. If you have never played the series, warbits is worth your time just on the writing alone. I lost track of how many times I've laughed out loud (in the literal sense) because of the writing and I'm always sending screenshots to friends. I haven't dabbled in online play or challenge mode yet but if it's even 10% as good as the campaign then I would say this is the best value you'll find in a strategy game. My only desire is that they optimize the game for iPhone X, but that's just nitpicking at this point.

title.label: Great Turn-Based Strategy; No In-Ap Purchase BS

content.label: Games like this are hard to find. It's a great turn-based strategy game with a fun feel, and so far, no in-ap purchase BS. Worth every penny!

Almost flawlessly executed turn-based strategy game. The single player campaign and challenges will provide many hours of play time. The AI is pretty good but not as good as a skilled human. The multiplayer is good but could use some improvements such as: rankings/leaderboards, better game matching system, and a better way to message other players (e.g. Being able to directly invite other players to a game). I never played Advanced wars, but was big into the browser-based Weewar back in the day.  Weewar didn't have a campaign, but the multiplayer was amazing.  If Warbits can improve the multiplayer, then it would set the bar for turn-based strategy battle games.
The story is a bit silly but the gameplay reminds me of Advance Wars. I still need to see how the multiplayer is but I am enjoying it all the same.

title.label: Worth every penny. Spiritual port of Advanced wars

content.label:
If you loved the original advanced wars, you will love this game. 
It takes the core elements of what made AW amazing and adds to it the game without taking anything away. 
Itâ€™s a steal for 4.99 you will waste so much time on this game itâ€™s not even far. 
No micro transactions!!!!! 
To the developers.... thank you. You have made an AW lover so happy!!
Iâ€™m glad some people still know how to make a good strategy game. Pick it up and play and come back to it later on the campaign.
